item.title: New Angry Birds Toys in the Works Thanks to Rovio, The Loyal Subjects Partnership
item.description:
Summary

  • Rovio is partnering with The Loyal Subjects for a new line of Angry Birds toys and collectibles in 2026.
  • The collaboration will include a nostalgic aesthetic and fan-favorite characters.
  • Fans can look forward to high-quality, innovative products in the future, according to Rovio and TLS.

Fans of Angry Birds have plenty to look forward to on the horizon, as Rovio is partnering with The Loyal Subjects for a new line of high-quality toys and collectibles based on the franchise. This collaboration is slated to kick off with “a mind-blowing suite” of Angry Birds -themed products that will hit retailers in 2026.

Few franchises have left their mark in gaming history like Angry Birds . Since its debut in 2009, Rovio’s iconic IP has become one of the most ubiquitous names in mobile gaming and has further cemented its place in pop culture by branching out into other forms of media such as film and TV. Amid all of this, there have been loads of Angry Birds merchandise for fans to get their hands on, and now there’s good news for those who haven’t yet had their fill.

Rovio and leading toy brand The Loyal Subjects have announced a partnership to create a new line of Angry Birds toys, collectibles, and more. In teasing this new line, TLS stated that it will recreate the aesthetic of the earlier Angry Birds games, and that consumers can expect to see fan-favorite birds represented. What’s more, TLS is also working on a toy line to tie into the third film in the Angry Birds Movie series, which was confirmed to be in production last year.

Rovio and The Loyal Subjects Announce New Angry Birds Toy Line

The first collection of Angry Birds toys, collectibles, and plushes from The Loyal Subjects will arrive sometime in 2026, though fans will get their first look at the lineup later this year. Describing the partnership with Rovio, TLS stated how both companies value inspiring imagination and play in kids and adults alike. “The TLS team is soaring with excitement for Angry Birds ,” said brand CEO Jonathan Cathey, who expressed confidence in TLS’ ability to carry the torch for the franchise. Similarly, Rovio VP of Transmedia Hanna Valkeapaa-Nokkala expressed excitement at having TLS on board, saying, “We can’t wait for fans to experience these high-quality, innovative, and exciting toy lines firsthand!”

It’s clear from the announcement that the two companies are eager to take part in this partnership, with Cathey describing both as “sharing a North Star” promoting fun and a desire to create memorable products that fans of Angry Birds will love. Between said products and the upcoming release of The Angry Birds Movie 3 , there will be plenty to look forward to in the near future.

The Loyal Subjects has a lengthy history of partnerships under its belt, having created products for a wide range of popular brands including Marvel, Nickelodeon, and WWE. With this expertise, fans should expect quality merchandise when TLS’ Angry Birds line drops into retailers next year.

item.title: Best Offline Mobile Simulation Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Simulation games provide fun & entertaining experiences on various topics with varying levels of accuracy.
  • Some best offline mobile simulation games are SimCity BuildIt, Depotism 3K, WorldBox - God Simulator.
  • Titles like Stardew Valley & Mega Mall Story offer complete and engaging simulation experiences on different platforms.

Simulation games have been around for almost as long as gaming. Ever since the days of dial-up Internet, simulation games have provided players with tons of fun and entertaining experiences, regardless of the topic they cover. Some are extremely accurate, whereas others sacrifice some accuracy to make gameplay more fun.

Platforms like Steam have great free simulation titles in their library. However, a lot of them require an active Internet connection, which can be inconvenient for players who want to have a good time while they're on the road. Here are some of the best offline mobile simulation games out there.

5 SimCity BuildIt

A Decently Fun City-Building Title

  • The game features residential areas, as well as commercial and industrial buildings
  • Players must solve some of the most common real-life issues of a large city

With so many simulation games out there, the possibilities for different topics are almost endless. Some great titles in this genre are not part of a franchise. However, this is not the case for SimCity BuildIt , which is part of the SimCity catalog. Throughout the game, players will have to solve real-life situations including traffic, pollution and sewage, as well as other public issues that typically affect large cities.

The game's main concept is for it to be a freemium. However, it does have some annoying pop-up ads and in-game purchases, which is how the developers make money. SimCity BuildIt features commercial and industrial buildings which produce items, as well as residential zones which require constant upgrades. All in all, while the game has received mixed reviews, it certainly provides decent fun for what it offers. It should be noted that, while SimCity BuildIt can be played offline, players will be asked to connect to the Internet after a certain period.

4 Depotism 3K

When AI Takes Over, The Fun Begins

  • Platform(s): Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Windows, Linux, Xbox One, Mac operating systems, Android, iOS
  • Released: November 08, 2018
  • Developer(s): Konfa Games, Gameplay First LLC
  • Genre(s): Strategy Video Game, Simulation Game, Indie Game
  • Players take on the role of AI overlords
  • Preventing exhaustion and hunger in humans is key

Anyone concerned about the possibility of AI enslaving humanity in the near future should probably skip this title, as it could be a little triggering for them. On a more serious note, though, Depotism 3k presents players with a scenario where they can be the AI overlord and exploit humans to generate power and build an empire.

This title involves a ton of resource management as players will have to make sure that their human workers do not succumb to hunger or fatigue, which is sometimes easier said than done. This title is not only packed with simulation mechanics but also includes a few rogue-lite elements that complement it greatly. It's honestly surprising that Depotism 3k isn't more popular, as it could be argued that it is one of the best mobile simulation games out there.

3 WorldBox - God Simulator

A Game That Puts Control Of The World In Players' Hands

  • Platform(s): Android, iOS, Windows, macOS, Linux
  • Released: September 24, 2012
  • Developer(s): Maxim Karpenko
  • Genre(s): Simulation Video Game, Sandbox
  • Players have godlike powers and can choose to intervene in the events of their world
  • Four different races that fight for power and conquest

God simulators are extremely popular, and with good reason, as they typically feature fun game mechanics that put control and power in players’ hands. In WorldBox - God Simulator , players will have the chance to use many powers in their toolbox as they look after the creatures in their world, which include innocent animals in search of food, and greedy kings pushing to expand their territory.

This title also features four different civilized races, including orcs, elves, dwarves, and humans. Each one will try to expand their kingdom through colonization as players create more continents. Players will also have the choice to either intervene in the comings and goings of the creatures in their land or just sit back and watch what happens. All in all, WorldBox - God Simulator is definitely one of the best 2D simulation games out there.

2 Mega Mall Story

Managing, Expanding, And Maintaining Massive Malls Has Never Been More Fun

  • Platform(s): Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Windows, Xbox One, Android, iOS
  • Released: August 09, 2011
  • Developer(s): Kairosoft
  • Genre(s): Simulation Video Game, Casual Game, Strategy Video Game, Indie Game
  • Players can invest in developments around their mall to attract more customers
  • Customers can become a store's regular if they like its quality

While some simulation games are exclusive to PC, this is not the case for Mega Mall Story , which is available throughout various platforms, so many players can enjoy it. Managing a huge mall and ensuring that customers keep coming through the doors isn't everyone's cup of tea, but for those who want the challenge and are looking for a distraction for a long trip, this title is ideal.

Mega Mall Story features very interesting game mechanics, such as customers becoming regulars of a specific store when they're satisfied with its quality. As players go up in rank, so will their mall, and the more stars they get (up to 5), the more employees and advertising methods they'll gain access to. It's also possible to make investments to attract apartment complexes, office buildings and other developments that can bring in more people.

1 Stardew Valley

The Ultimate Farm Simulation Experience

  • Cooking, foraging and fishing are key game mechanics
  • Players must manage their resources wisely

Lastly, there's Stardew Valley , a title that has garnered a huge fan base since it was first released, and with good reason, as it offers tons of possibilities for players to explore. The story begins when players inherit their grandfather's farm plot in the quiet, yet friendly populace of Stardew Valley.

Throughout the game, players will have to collect various resources, including tools, hats, weapons, bait, and more. Fishing, foraging and cooking are key mechanics of this title and must be done often to progress. Stardew Valley is, without a doubt, one of the most comforting farming simulation games out there, and also one of the most complete and complex. Players looking for a gaming experience that will both allow them to sit back and relax as their farm plot grows, while also being tasked with gathering and managing resources, will certainly love this title and everything around it.

item.title: Ninja Time: How to Unlock the Friends Quest
item.description:
Each shinobi in Ninja Time can learn different techniques to become the strongest. Though some can be unlocked simply by increasing stats, others require the completion of quests, and the Friends quest is no exception to this.

Unlike other quests, this one is blocked for most players of this Roblox RPG. This is because the NPC will only offer you the quest if you fulfill secret conditions not mentioned anywhere. For those unsure about how to do so, here's how to unlock the Friends quest in Ninja Time .

Where to Find Renegade Prisoner in Ninja Time

Before you can start the Friends quest in Ninja Time , you need to find a certain NPC, namely Renegade Prisoner. This character is not marked on the map, which makes him very easy to miss. Luckily, if you know where to look, you can get to him quite easily.

You need to move southeast from Konoha until you reach the Uchiha village . There, players should visit a building similar to a police station with cells for criminals. Inside one of the cells, you will find Renegade Prisoner.

How to Unlock the Friends Quest in Ninja Time

Although Renegade Prisoner does not say so, players must fulfill an important condition: obtain a certain skill mode called Crimson Inferno before starting the Friends quest.

Players should note that it is only available to members of the Red Eyes clan. To unlock it, you need to upgrade your Eyes skill tree .

When you finally unlock this skill, you must use it to enter Crimson Inferno mode. It doesn't affect your character visually, but while it is active, you can talk to Renegade Prisoner and start the Friends quest in Ninja Time . To complete it, you need to kill 5 friends . You can even kill one friend 5 times to complete the quest, and you do not need to be a member of the same party to do this.

After that, players need to visit the Uchiha Shelter building and take turns standing on the blue squares behind the counter. One of them is a hidden passage to the underground floor, where there is an ancient stone tablet. Interact with it to unlock Susanoo, one of the most powerful techniques of the Red Eyes. And depending on your Red Eyes clan, your Susanoo skill will be different in this Roblox game.

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet & Violet: Best Dragon Types In The Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Dragon-type Pokemon like Haxorus, Latios, and Kommo-o are powerful additions for competitive play.
  • Legendary Dragon-types like Reshiram, Zekrom, and Rayquaza are available to capture in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet.
  • Unique Dragon-type Pokemon like Roaring Moon, Archaludon, and Baxcalibur offer diverse and powerful options for players.

The Pokemon franchise is known to have a variety of powerful Pokemon with numerous type combinations, from the simple Fire and Water to ones like Psychic or Fairy. Arguably one of the strongest types in the franchise's long history has been Dragon-types , which were originally introduced in the first generation games.

Game Freak continues to create interesting dragon-type Pokemon for players to catch. With so many new additions to the franchise, as well as plenty of old favorites, these are by far the strongest Dragon-type Pokemon players should try capturing while exploring Paldea in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet .

Updated March 2, 2025, by Blaise Santi: It's been an exciting week for Pokemon fans now that footage of Pokemon Legends Z-A has finally been revealed. This follow-up to Pokemon Legends Arceus will likely introduce some new Dragon-type Pokemon, particularly as new forms of older Pokemon, to the mainline series, which will certainly be used a lot in future generations' competitive scenes. However, Scarlet & Violet users who haven't picked the game up in a while may not know that some of the strongest Dragon-type Pokemon are now obtainable in the Gen 9 games thanks to functionality of Pokemon HOME as well as special Event Raids. Take a look at this updated list of the best Dragon-types in Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , including some iconic mascots from the series' past!

30 Haxorus

The Axe Jaw Pokemon

Type

Dragon

Abilities

Rivalry, Mold Breaker, Unnerve

Learned Moves

Breaking Swipe, Outrage, Dragon Pulse, Crunch, Giga Impact

Catch Locations

Tera Raid Battles

Pokedex Entry

This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.

In terms of Gen 5 Pokemon, Haxorus often gets the short end of the stick by not being a pseudo legendary. However, it's a fairly straight-forward pure-Dragon-type with a staggering physical Attack base stat. Paired with decent speed and the useful Ability, Mold Breaker, Haxorus can make for a big threat in the competitive scene with the right movepool.

Aside from its learned moves, Haxorus gains incredible coverage with access to Earthquake and Poison Jab, which will both counter its biggest weaknesses. It can strengthen these moves with Terastallization, though some players may prefer keeping Haxorus' Tera-type as Dragon in order to make its physical STAB moves even more painful.

29 Latios & Latias

The Eon Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Psychic

Abilities

Levitate

Learned Moves

Dragon Breath, Dragon Pulse, Zen Headbutt, Luster Purge (Latios), Mist Ball (Latias), Tailwind, Memento (Latios), Charm (Latias), Recover

Catch Locations

Area Two (Latios), Area Four (Latias)

Pokedex Entry

Latios: It is a highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its forelegs in flight, it can overtake jet planes. Latias: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.

Latios and Latias are grouped together here simply because they share a lot of similar qualities, and not just in terms of their design. Stats-wise, the only major difference between Latios and Latias is Latios' preference for Attack and Special Attack compared to Latias' Defense and Special Defense, but even their movepools are remarkably similar.

Even in competitive play, they serve similar functions as potential Choice Specs sweepers, utilizing their equivalent speeds to become powerful special attackers. They're both also capable of getting mileage out of the unique item Soul Dew, which boosts Latios and Latias' Dragon and Psychic-type STAB attacks. With their unique type combinations, they're very underrated.

28 Kommo-o

The Scaly Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Fighting

Abilities

Bulletproof, Soundproof, Overcoat

Learned Moves

Clanging Scales, Clangorous Soul, Close Combat, Iron Defense, Boomburst

Catch Locations

Tera Raid Battles

Pokedex Entry

It bashes its scales to test its opponents' mettle. The sound of struck Kommo-o scales frightens weaker foes and sends them running.

Kommo-o was introduced in Pokemon Sun & Moon , but as of The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero , it can appear in Tera Raid Battles in Scarlet & Violet , or transferred over from Pokemon HOME . Prior to Koraidon, Kommo-o's Dragon/Fighting-typing was unique, allowing it to boast incredible Attack and Defense stats that can be quite rare for other Dragon-type Pokemon.

As of the previous generation, there's one particular item that's simply made for Kommo-o: Throat Spray. This consumable held item will boost a Pokemon's Special Attack after using a sound move, of which Kommo-o has many. It also makes for a strong Physical Attacker in Doubles matches, so don't underestimate this Pokemon just because Koraidon exists.

27 Gouging Fire

The Paradox Pokemon

Type

Fire/Dragon

Abilities

Protosynthesis

Learned Moves

Burning Bulwark, Raging Fury, Dragon Rush, Outrage, Bite, Double Kick, Ancient Power, Crush Claw

Catch Locations

Area Zero ( Pokemon Scarlet: The Indigo Disk )

Pokedex Entry

It resembles an eerie Pokémon once shown in a paranormal magazine. That Pokémon was said to be an Entei regenerated from a fossil.

Alongside the Raikou-reminiscent Raging Bolt, Gouging Fire is a brand-new Paradox Pokemon introduced in The Indigo Disk . This Fire/Dragon-type appears to be an ancestor of the Gen 2 Legendary Pokemon Entei, sporting a golden crest on its head. Unlike Entei, Gouging Fire learns some pretty powerful Dragon-type moves, like Dragon Rush and Outrage.

However, Gouging Fire's biggest positive is the unique move Burning Bulwark, which only it can learn. The move works similarly to Protect, but for opponents who make direct contact with the shield, they are burned.

26 Walking Wake

The Paradox Pokemon

Type

Water/Dragon

Abilities

Protosynthesis

Learned Moves

Hydro Steam, Aqua Jet, Breaking Swipe, Dragon Breath, Flamethrower, Bite, Noble Roar

Catch Locations

Event distribution

Pokedex Entry

It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.

Rounding out the Paradox forms of Gen 2's Legendary beasts is the Water/Dragon-type Walking Wake, which resembles a prehistoric form of Suicune. It also learns the unique signature move Hydro Steam, which receives an attack boost when used in harsh sunlight. This pairs extremely well with Walking Wake's ability Protosynthesis, which it shares with other past Paradox Pokemon.

With Protosynthesis, a Pokemon's highest base stat will be boosted in harsh sunlight (or when holding a Booster Energy). Since Walking Wake's highest stat is already Special Attack, the special move Hydro Steam will be even more powerful in harsh sunlight than it already would be.

25 Dragonite

The Dragon Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Flying

Abilities

Inner Focus, Multiscale

Learned Moves

Dragon Tail, Outrage, Hurricane, Roost, Fire Punch, Thunder Wave, Rain Dance, Agility, Extreme Speed

Catch Locations

Casseroya Lake

Pokedex Entry

It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.

It's simply hard to find much wrong with Dragonite, other than the fact it only evolves from Dragonair at the extremely-late level 55. This Dragon/Flying-type and its evolutionary line are notably one of the first Dragon-types in the entire franchise, a status it held until the addition of only Kingdra in Gen 2. Nevertheless, Dragonite has remained a top-tier Pokemon for many generations.

There are a lot of positives to Dragonite, competitively speaking, from its Hidden Ability Multiscale, which reduces damages at full HP, its incredibly diverse movepool, including moves like Aqua Tail, Fire Punch, and Stomping Tantrum, and its incredibly high stats, especially Attack. For the very first pseudo-legendary, Dragonite is about as nearly-legendary as it gets.

24 Goodra

The Dragon & Shell Bunker Pokemon

Type

Dragon, Dragon/Steel (Hisuian form)

Abilities

Sap Sipper, Hydration, Gooey, Shell Armor (Hisuian form)

Learned Moves

Dragon Breath, Dragon Pulse, Iron Head (Hisuian form), Shelter (Hisuian form), Muddy Water, Absorb, Acid Spray, Curse, Body Slam

Catch Locations

Evolve Sliggoo, Tera Raid Battles, Pokemon HOME (Hisuian form)

Pokedex Entry

It loves the rain. This mellow Pokémon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.

Speaking of pseudo-legendaries, Goodra is perhaps one of the more underrated pseudo-legendary evolutionary lines. Introduced in Pokemon X & Y , the pure Dragon-type was notable for access to useful Abilities like Sap Sipper and Gooey, as well as its movepool including a solid selection of Water-type, Grass-type, and Poison-type moves.

However, it was Pokemon Legends: Arceus that really boosted Goodra's favor with hardcore Pokemon fans. The Hisui region introduced a regional form of Goodra that is Dragon/Steel, with moves to complement its new STAB capabilities and increased Defense at the cost of some Speed, making it a bulkier and, frankly, much more appealing Pokemon for any team.

23 Tatsugiri

The Mimicry Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Water

Abilities

Commander, Storm Drain

Learned Moves

Dragon Pulse, Water Pulse, Muddy Water, Nasty Plot, Mirror Coat, Helping Hand

Catch Locations

Casseroya Lake

Pokedex Entry

This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.

It's surprising to think that this small fish that replicates the look of a piece of Sushi is a Dragon-type Pokemon. However, it is exactly that. Tatsugiri may appear as one of the weakest Dragon-types in the game, but they are also incredibly intelligent. They call upon the aid of Dondozo to help them in not only battle but also to get food.

While taking part in two vs. two battles, Tatsugiri may use its signature ability of Commander, which allows it to hop into the mouth of an ally Dondozo that is on the field. While in this match-up, Tatsugiri is unable to be hit.

22 Dragalge

The Mock Kelp Pokemon

Type

Poison/Dragon

Abilities

Poison Point, Poison Touch, Adaptability

Learned Moves

Sludge Bomb, Acid, Dragon Pulse, Outrage, Aqua Tail, Double Team

Catch Locations

North Paldean Sea

Pokedex Entry

Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.

Dragalge is an incredible Dragon/Poison-Type Pokemon. It is not only a great choice for those looking for a Dragon for their roster but also for those looking for an incredibly powerful Poison-type. With Special Defense being one of its highest stats, Dragalge is also sure to stay alive in various battles, as it can also hit hard.

Some Pokemon in Scarlet and Violet are version exclusives, and Dragalge can only be found in Pokemon Scarlet . Thankfully, players who own Pokemon Violet can still get their hands on this Mock Kelp Pokemon by trading with a player who has the other version of the game.

21 Altaria

The Humming Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Flying

Abilities

Natural Cure, Cloud Nine

Learned Moves

Dragon Breath, Dragon Pulse, Pluck, Sky Attack, Moonblast, Cotton Guard, Mist, Perish Song

Catch Locations

Casseroya Lake

Pokedex Entry

If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop the friend with its soft wings, then hum.

Although Altaria doesn't look like a typical Dragon-type Pokemon, it has earned itself a place as one of the best Dragon-types a player may wish to consider. Players can either find Altaria flying around in the wild or capture a Swablu and evolve it at around level 35.

As its fluffy cloud-like wings that wrap around its body suggest, Altaria is also a Flying-type Pokemon. This typing may have become less useful in recent games since players can fast-travel around the map freely, but Altaria continues to be a powerful member of any player's team.

20 Appletun

The Apple Nectar Pokemon

Type

Grass/Dragon

Abilities

Ripen, Gluttony, Thick Fat

Learned Moves

Apple Acid, Energy Ball, Dragon Pulse, Astonish, Iron Defense, Withdraw, Stomp

Catch Locations

Mossfell Confluence

Pokedex Entry

It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokémon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.

Appeltun is another interesting Pokemon that players will likely want on their teams, not only for its adorable appearance but also for its powerful Dragon and Grass-type attacks. Appletun evolves from Applin once given a Sweet Apple. If given a Tart Apple instead, Applin becomes Flapple, which is another great Dragon-type that players should consider.

In addition to the usual Dragon-type moves available to the Pokemon, Appletun is also the only monster that can learn the move Apple Acid. This Grass-Type move deals substantial damage while also lowering the target's Special Defense. This benefits Appletun greatly, as its best stats involve its Special Attack.

19 Cyclizar

The Mount Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Normal

Abilities

Shed Skin, Regenerator

Learned Moves

Dragon Claw, Dragon Rush, Shed Tail, Double-Edge, Shift Gear, U-Turn, Bite

Catch Locations

East Province Area One, Two, Asado Desert

Pokedex Entry

Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

Cyclizar may be considered quite basic compared to its futuristic relative Miraidon and its ancient ancestor Koraidon. However, this doesn't stop Cyclizar from being an exciting choice early in the game until players can use their own legendary in battle.

Combining Dragon with Normal may not seem that special, but this does mean that players have a Pokemon that can confidentially go up against a Ghost-type Pokemon without worrying about its move set. Besides, Cyclizar is an adorable Pokemon to have on the team; it's just unfortunate that players can't use them as a vehicle like the other NPCs can.

18 Noivern

The Sound Wave Pokemon

Type

Flying/Dragon

Abilities

Frisk, Infiltrator, Telepathy

Learned Moves

Hurricane, Air Slash, Dragon Pulse, Moonlight, Bite, Absorb, Boomburst

Catch Locations

North Province Area One, Two

Pokedex Entry

In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokémon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.

Stepping away from the newest Pokemon added with Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , players may also remember this Dragon-type from Pokemon X & Y , the bat Pokemon, Noivern. Evolving from Noibat, some players may think Noivern would be a combination of Dark/Dragon, but it is actually Flying/Dragon-typed. Players would first need to evolve Noibat if they wish to have this dragon bat.

One mustn't be fooled by its adorable design, as Noivern has been known to be incredibly cruel to Pokemon in the dark and incredibly timid in the light. Luckily, many players will find this Pokemon exploring the outdoors, instead of a damp cave.

17 Hydrapple

An Incredibly Powerful Evolution Of Applin

Type

Grass/Dragon

Abilities

Supersweet Syrup, Regenerator, Sticky Hold

Learned Moves

Syrup Bomb, Bullet Seed, Fickle Beam, Dragon Breath, Infestation, Withdraw, Astonish, Recover

Catch Locations

Evolve Dipplin

Pokedex Entry

These capricious syrpents have banded together. On the rare occasion that their moods align, their true power is unleashed.

Applin is a Pokemon that already has multiple different evolutions depending on the sort of apple it gets from the player. This has led to two brand-new evolution paths in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet . When Applin is given a Syrupy Apple, it evolves into Dipplin, but unlike Flapple or Appletun, this evolutionary line doesn't stop there.

This Pokemon can evolve a step further into Hydrapple if the player levels it up while knowing the Dragon Cheer move, causing it to become an even more powerful Grass and Dragon-type Pokemon, with a fierce special attack. Hydrapple is also the only Pokemon to know the ability Supersweet Syrup, which lowers the evasion of a target.

16 Raging Bolt

The Paradox Pokemon

Type

Electric/Dragon

Abilities

Protosynthesis

Learned Moves

Rising Voltage, Zap Cannon, Dragon Hammer, Twister, Sunny Day, Body Press, Calm Mind, Ancient Power, Stomp

Catch Locations

Area Zero ( Pokemon Scarlet: The Indigo Disk )

Pokedex Entry

It bears resemblance to a Pokémon that became a hot topic for a short while after a paranormal magazine touted it as Raikou's ancestor.

Players may find Paradox Pokemon from Pokemon Scarlet and Violet to look quite familiar, such as Raging Bolt. That's because this Paradox Pokemon appears to be an ancient relative of the legendary Electric-type Pokemon Raikou that players are likely to have encountered during the second generation of the franchise.

With this in mind, Raging Bolt combines these legendary Electric-type moves with the Dragon-type to create an incredibly deadly force against other trainers. With an even more incredible Special Attack, the electricity that is created from its fur is sure to trample the competition.

15 Giratina

The Renegade Pokemon

Type

Ghost/Dragon

Abilities

Pressure, Telepathy, Levitate (Origin form)

Learned Moves

Shadow Force, Destiny Bond, Dragon Breath, Dragon Claw, Ancient Power, Earth Power, Aura Sphere, Defog, Pain Split

Catch Locations

Pokemon HOME, Event

Pokedex Entry

A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.

Giratina is one of the few Legendary Pokemon unobtainable by regular means in Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , though post-DLC, it's possible to transfer it over from Pokemon HOME. That means that players who were fortunate enough to catch Giratina in Pokemon Legends: Arceus (or have even kept their Legendary Pokemon around since Pokemon Platinum ) can use it in-game.

Competitively, Giratina is one of the best Legendary Pokemon out there, with the incredibly useful Ghost/Dragon type making it immune to Normal and Fighting-type moves. It can utilize Terastallization to become Fairy-type and have coverage against its Fairy and Dark-type weaknesses.

14 Reshiram

The Vast White Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Fire

Abilities

Turboblaze

Learned Moves

Dragon Pulse, Outrage, Flamethrower, Blue Flare, Ancient Power, Extrasensory, Crunch, Hyper Voice

Catch Locations

Area One (East Province), after receiving the Reshiram Treat from Snacksworth at Blueberry Academy

Pokedex Entry

This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

The mascot legendary for Pokemon Black is surprisingly obtainable in Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , though it requires players to have the DLC expansion The Indigo Disk . For completing solo quests in Blueberry Academy, an NPC named Snacksworth will reward players with a "treat" corresponding to Legendary Pokemon, allowing them to be caught in various spots around Paldea.

Reshiram, however, is exclusive to Pokemon Scarlet , meaning Pokemon Violet users will have to trade or utilize Pokemon HOME to acquire their own. Competitively, Reshiram has impeccable stats and a great movepool. Its Fairy-type and Ice-type weaknesses are neutralized by its dual-typing with Fire, making it only weak to Ground, Rock, and Dragon-type moves.

13 Zekrom

The Deep Black Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Electric

Abilities

Teravolt

Learned Moves

Dragon Claw, Outrage, Fusion Bolt, Bolt Strike, Ancient Power, Zen Headbutt, Crunch, Slash

Catch Locations

Area Five (South Province), after receiving the Zekrom Treat from Snacksworth at Blueberry Academy

Pokedex Entry

This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

Reshiram's counterpart, Zekrom, is similarly obtainable from Snacksworth exclusively for players of Pokemon Violet . After completing 100 solo quests at Blueberry Academy, Snackworth will give the player a Zekrom Treat. This will allow them to encounter and potentially catch this Dragon/Electric-type Pokemon from Pokemon White .

As an Uber-tiered Pokemon in the competitive scene, Zekrom pairs well with a moveset that has high-powered STAB moves like Bolt Strike and Dragon Claw. Lots of players also pair Zekrom with Dragon Dance, boosting its already-incredible physical Attack as well as its surprisingly disappointing Speed stat, making it a sweeping powerhouse on any team.

12 Rayquaza

The Sky High Pokemon

Type

Dragon/Flying

Abilities

Air Lock, Delta Stream (Mega Rayquaza)

Learned Moves

Twister, Dragon Pulse, Dragon Ascent, Hurricane, Ancient Power, Rest, Crunch, Extreme Speed

Catch Locations

Event, Great Crater of Paldea, after receiving the Rayquaza Treat from Snacksworth at Blueberry Academy

Pokedex Entry

A Pokémon that flies endlessly in the ozone layer. It is said it would descend to the ground if Kyogre and Groudon were to fight.

Sadly, Mega Evolution isn't an option in Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , meaning the overpowered Mega Rayquaza can't join a team. Nevertheless, groups of players can team up to complete group quests at Blueberry Academy, eventually rewarding them with a Rayquaza Treat. This will allow players to encounter a Rayquaza in the Great Crater of Paldea.

However, some lucky players had the chance to catch a shiny Rayquaza in a special Event raid in December 2024, with the Dragon Tera type. Sadly, it ended in January 2025, meaning most Scarlet & Violet players just missed their chances. Nevertheless, maybe scouring online trade forums is a great way to obtain this special Rayquaza.

11 Dialga

The Temporal Pokemon

Type

Steel/Dragon

Abilities

Pressure, Telepathy

Learned Moves

Flash Cannon, Iron Tail, Dragon Breath, Roar of Time, Power Gem, Earth Power, Aura Sphere, Slash

Catch Locations

Pokemon HOME, Event

Pokedex Entry

It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

Dialga has always been one of the best-designed Legendary Pokemon, but thanks to Pokemon Legends Arceus , it's even more special. This Gen 4 mascot cannot be caught under ordinary means in Pokemon Scarlet & Violet. Players must either transfer it from Pokemon HOME or wait for another Dialga Tera raid to hit the Gen 9 titles.

However, if players manage to acquire a Dialga in Scarlet & Violet , there's an additional item they should locate: the Adamant Crystal. This can be bought at the Porto Marinada auction, but only if players currently own a Dialga. In its Origin Forme, Dialga trades some of its physical Attack stats for some increased Special Defense, which is handy for players with a Special Attack-focused Dialga set.

item.title: Rune Slayer: How to Get the Assassin Set
item.description:
In Rune Slayer , players can craft or buy different pieces of equipment, and some sets can significantly boost one's character. The Assassin set is one such example, and players would do well to acquire it.

This armor is one of the best that you can find in this Roblox RPG. It is great for Agility characters, especially the Thief class, but players will need to prepared to spend quite a lot of time getting the whole set. Here's a rundown on how to get the Assassin set in Rune Slayer .

How to Find the Assassin Set in Rune Slayer

Unlike other gear, the pieces of the Assassin set in Rune Slayer can only be obtained by completing quests for the Thieves Guild . But as befits such a Guild, they are quite well hidden and do not offer work to anyone.

To get the Assassin set in Rune Slayer , you must complete a series of quests for Saegar . This NPC is initially located in the Goblin Caves, so you can visit him by following the quests of the Adventurer's Guild. He will ask you to kill James, who is in Pinewood Thickets. Upon doing so, you need to return to him for a reward.

It is important to note that, after this quest, the Saegar NPC will move to the Thieves Guild. So, to find him, move northeast from Ashenshire until you reach a huge mountain. On one of its sides, players can find a small door leading to the Guild.

At the Thieves Guild, Saegar will give you contracts to kill certain people. If you succeed, you will receive good rewards, including armor. But of course, you will not be given the entire set at once; each quest will reward you with a piece of Assassin set.

  • Saegar's Contract 2 - Kill Krogar to get Assassin's Boots
  • Saegar's Contract 3 - Kill Silas to get Assassin's Hood
  • Saegar's Contract 4 - Kill Vaelion to get Assassin's Cloak

Rune Slayer - Assassin Set Stats

The Assassin set offers players high bonuses to Agility. So, if your build is based on this stat, this armor will suit you perfectly. However, to wear it, you need to be at least level 25 . If you meet this condition, you will get the following stat bonuses while wearing the entire Assassin set in Rune Slayer .

Armor Piece

Stats

Assassin's Hood

  • Armor: 220
  • Agility: +8
  • Spirit: +2

Assassin's Cloak

  • Armor: 425
  • Agility: +16
  • Spirit: +4
  • Crit Chance: +2%

Assassin's Boots

  • Armor: 220
  • Agility: +8
  • Spirit: +2
